intro: Spetaea lachenaliiflora, commonly known as the Lachenal's spetaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, where it faces harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale blue, arranged in a compact inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Spetaea lachenaliiflora is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
